thread.title: SEC Shorts: Kids finally have a way to simulate going up against the Crimson Tide defensive line
thread.title_full: SEC Shorts: Kids finally have a way to simulate going up against the Crimson Tide defensive line

author: Robert Clay | rclay@al.com
title: SEC Shorts: Kids finally have a way to simulate going up against the Crimson Tide defensive line
text:
Comments 
The Alabama Crimson Tide defensive line has been one of the best units in the country. After a dominating performance against Arkansas, the SEC Shorts team wondered what would be the best way for a kid to simulate playing a game of backyard football against the big hog mollies. For kids wanting to embark on this daring experience, they should look no further than this new toy commercial. 
Check out in the latest installment of SEC Shorts by AL.com Studios. SEC Shorts, created by Robert Clay and Josh Snead, is a weekly sketch comedy segment offering a look at the lighter side of fan culture and storylines surrounding SEC sports. Follow them on Twitter @roberttheclay and @josnead
